text: It's interesting how Metroid Prime truly transferred the Metroid saga into 3D flawlessly...I mean, when you play Super Metroid and Metroid Prime, they practically feel like the same gameplay style, just one in 2D and the other one in 3D.
author: Pedro Gomez

text: Nintendo's very good at that. While all the other companies were freaking out about bringing their games into 3D, Nintendo just kinda came out at them with Ocarina of Time and Super Mario 64 like it wasn't even a problem. Metroid was a late bloomer, but I think it was worth it - I'd definitely agree about the flawless transfer.

author: YolmzWelra

text: This game was so cohesive and ahead of its time. When so many games were trying to be movies, linear, and objective based, this game told a cryptic story you had to discover, had immersive environments, privileged discovery, and frankly did stuff right that a lot of big budget games still get wrong.

author: Bosspuma

text: Halo 1 & 2 have one the best best BEST campaigns/story.  Metroid Prime, Echoes, and Corruption are great games (Prime 1 and 2 higher than 3).  Both Halo and Metroid Prime's plot/story is flawed at times, but Prime's gameplay is so phenomenal, detective-like, and mysterious. They are both "objective-based" at times, moreso with Halo, I think. Halo's story is also mysterious. They both have great plots that run deep with mystery and intrigue. Big fan of Xbox (original-NOT 360) & gamecube.

author: AlphaBlast

text:
I am disappointed by that. Metroid Prime's 2 and 3 are to Metroid Prime 1 what Majora's Mask is to Ocarina of time. They compliment each other, filling in the gaps that the others didn't. Prime 1 had the history and the openness, Prime 2 had the atmosphere and the puzzles, and Prime 3 had the action and the story. Don't go saying any of them are inferior to one another, because they all kick ass.

...Ok, I'm done.
